alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Madison; McNairy (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 1:06AM CDT until August 10 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following counties, Benton, Carroll, Chester, Decatur, Hardin, Henderson, Madison and McNairy. * WHEN...Until 300 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 106 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lexington, Henderson, Natchez Trace State Forest, Natchez Trace State Park, Parsons, Adamsville, Decaturville, Sardis, Reagan, Darden, Jacks Creek, Wildersville, Parkers Crossroads, Bargerton, Mifflin, Morris Chapel, Blue Goose, Montgomery, McNairy and Scotts Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
